MS.S: The Microsoft Security Response Center module gets Microsoft Security Update details_x000D__x000A_and CVRF (Common Vulnerability Reporting Format) documents in either JSON or XML._x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_This module calls the MSRC API (api.msrc.microsoft.com) which requires an API key from:_x000D__x000A_https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com

February 9, 2017 - Initial release to https://github.com/Microsoft/MSRC-Microsoft-Security-Updates-API_x000D__x000A_March 8, 2017 - Refactored into a script module and added basic Pester tests_x000D__x000A_March 14, 2017 - Added some error handling for when fields are not in the returned CVRF api reply_x000D__x000A_March 28, 2017 - Added Get-MsrcVulnerabilityReportHtml_x000D__x000A_March 30, 2017 - PR from MVP (https://github.com/p0w3rsh3ll) Split module into public and private functions, etc _x000D__x000A_April 5, 2017 - Added ability to use Azure AD tokens, the module now supports calling the APIs with an API key or AAD token_x000D__x000A_April 18, 2017 - Small HTML change to Get-MsrcSecurityBulletinHtml.ps1_x000D__x000A_April 28, 2017 - Bug fixes and some refactoring_x000D__x000A_May 3, 2017 - Added Proxy support, Updates to Get-MsrcVulnerabilityReportHtml_x000D__x000A_May 5, 2017 - Further updates to Get-MsrcVulnerabilityReportHtml_x000D__x000A_May 9, 2017 - Changed the string from "unknown" to "N/A" when a cvss score is null from the cvrf response_x000D__x000A_May 10, 2017 - fixed a typo that was causing FAQ to not display correctly_x000D__x000A_May 30, 2017 - Added tags to the table of contents, as well as changing the KB article text to be hyperlinked, and show the subtype if possible._x000D__x000A_May 31, 2017 - Removed padding between table of contents cells to reduce wasted space_x000D__x000A_June 2, 2017 - Added a fix to allow for multiline KB articles

The Microsoft Security Response Center module gets Microsoft Security Update details_x000D__x000A_and CVRF (Common Vulnerability Reporting Format) documents in either JSON or XML._x000D__x000A__x000D__x000A_This module calls the MSRC API (api.msrc.microsoft.com) which requires an API key from:_x000D__x000A_https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com

February 9, 2017 - Initial release to https://github.com/Microsoft/MSRC-Microsoft-Security-Updates-API_x000D__x000A_March 8, 2017 - Refactored into a script module and added basic Pester tests_x000D__x000A_March 14, 2017 - Added some error handling for when fields are not in the returned CVRF api reply_x000D__x000A_March 28, 2017 - Added Get-MsrcVulnerabilityReportHtml_x000D__x000A_March 30, 2017 - PR from MVP (https://github.com/p0w3rsh3ll) Split module into public and private functions, etc _x000D__x000A_April 5, 2017 - Added ability to use Azure AD tokens, the module now supports calling the APIs with an API key or AAD token_x000D__x000A_April 18, 2017 - Small HTML change to Get-MsrcSecurityBulletinHtml.ps1_x000D__x000A_April 28, 2017 - Bug fixes and some refactoring_x000D__x000A_May 3, 2017 - Added Proxy support, Updates to Get-MsrcVulnerabilityReportHtml_x000D__x000A_May 5, 2017 - Further updates to Get-MsrcVulnerabilityReportHtml_x000D__x000A_May 9, 2017 - Changed the string from "unknown" to "N/A" when a cvss score is null from the cvrf response_x000D__x000A_May 10, 2017 - fixed a typo that was causing FAQ to not display correctly_x000D__x000A_May 30, 2017 - Added tags to the table of contents, as well as changing the KB article text to be hyperlinked, and show the subtype if possible._x000D__x000A_May 31, 2017 - Removed padding between table of contents cells to reduce wasted space_x000D__x000A_June 2, 2017 - Added a fix to allow for multiline KB articles
